Many economists don‚Äôt think it will get this bad, but if it rises to even 5%, the cost will be $1 Trillion in annual payments.  For comparison, the Federal Government spends ~$1.2 Trillion per year on Social Security and ~$1.4 Trillion on Medicare.
If we were paying interest on the debt of 10% last year, the cost of our interest on the debt would be ~$2 Trillion. Almost the cost Social Security and Medicare combined.
Why is there a risk debt payments will balloon?  In the 1980‚Äôs when inflation was last at ~8%, average interest on the debt was ~10%.

Our current Treasury debt has different maturity dates and the impact will not be felt immediately. But it will be felt soon. It will increase over time as new debt is issued. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FR7uMy4XsAA2dsW.png

Following today‚Äôs #FederalReserve action, the interest on the debt went up 0.5%. This doesn‚Äôt sound like a lot but it means we will now have an additional interest payment of about ~$100B or the cost of all federal housing programs.

For the last decade #interestrates have been very low. Last year interest on the debt cost taxpayers $580B with an average interest rate of ~1.5%. That‚Äôs equal to the cost of all veterans and transportation programs combined.
